title: Eukaryotic Memory Architecture Principles
description: The Subject-Object-Hybrid Git system and the Google Drive synchronization layer.

values.name: Subject-Object-Hybrid Git System
values.rule: Repositories are hybrid entities managed by Git and cloud-synced blobs.
values.description: The "Hybrid" state occurs when a repository acts as a passthrough for nested subjects while simultaneously maintaining its own local subjects (e.g., comms/ logs).
values.rationale: Ensures absolute forensic traceability while maintaining a decentralized, fractal hierarchy.

values.name: .gitignore for Context (README.ai Deprecated)
values.rule: README.ai is DEPRECATED (only the root meta-git relies on it). Repository context is now provided via structured comments within the .gitignore file.
values.rationale: Using .gitignore comments reduces file bloat and ensures that repository metadata is stored in a location already recognized by Git and agents.

values.name: Eukaryotic Sync Layer
values.rule: Big files and high-entropy blobs are stored via Google Drive layer to maintain Git low-latency.
values.rationale: Prevents repository bloating and maintains session responsiveness.
